item.title: ConsciousNYC add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "The future depends on what you do today." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: ConsciousNYC add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "I like your Christ, I do not like your Christians. Your Christians are so unlike your Christ." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: ConsciousNYC add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "There is no escape—we pay for the violence of our ancestors." -- Frank Herbert

item.title: ConsciousNYC add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "In the end, we will remember not the words of our enemies, but the silence of our friends." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: ConsciousNYC add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You have brains in your head. You have feet in your shoes. You can steer yourself any direction you choose. You're on your own. And you know what you know. And YOU are the one who'll decide where to go..." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: ConsciousNYC add a quote by Isaac Bashevis Singer
item.description: "I believe in God but people are liars. It's those people who say they are appointed by God who I don't believe in." -- Isaac Bashevis Singer

item.title: ConsciousNYC add a quote by Marcus Garvey
item.description: "The ends you serve that are selfish will take you no further than yourself but the ends you serve that are for all, in common, will take you into eternity." -- Marcus Garvey

item.title: ConsciousNYC add a quote by Ovid
item.description: "When he, whoever of the gods it was, had thus arranged in order and resolved that chaotic mass, and reduced it, thus resolved, to cosmic parts, he first moulded the Earth into the form of a mighty ball so that it might be of like form on every side … And, that no region might be without its own forms of animate life, the stars and divine forms occupied the floor of heaven, the sea fell to the shining fishes for their home, Earth received the beasts, and the mobile air the birds … Then Man was born:… though all other animals are prone, and fix their gaze upon the earth, he gave to Man an uplifted face and bade him stand erect and turn his eyes to heaven." -- Ovid

item.title: ConsciousNYC add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "Don't think. Thinking is the enemy of creativity. It's self-conscious and anything self-conscious is lousy. You can't "try" to do things. You simply "must" do things." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: ConsciousNYC add a quote by Carl Gustav Jung
item.description: "One does not become enlightened by imagining figures of light, but by making the darkness conscious." -- Carl Gustav Jung

item.title: ConsciousNYC add a quote by C.G. Jung
item.description: "Until you make the unconscious conscious, it will direct your life and you will call it fate." -- C.G. Jung

item.title: ConsciousNYC add a quote by Toni Morrison
item.description: "As you enter positions of trust and power, dream a little before you think." -- Toni Morrison

item.title: ConsciousNYC add a quote by Toni Morrison
item.description: "Definitions belong to the definers, not the defined." -- Toni Morrison

item.title: ConsciousNYC add a quote by Toni Morrison
item.description: "The function of freedom is to free someone else." -- Toni Morrison

item.title: ConsciousNYC add a quote by Apple Computer Inc.
item.description: "Here's to the crazy ones. The misfits. The rebels. The troublemakers. The round pegs in the square holes. The ones who see things differently. They're not fond of rules. And they have no respect for the status quo. You can quote them, disagree with them, glorify or vilify them. About the only thing you can't do is ignore them. Because they change things. They push the human race forward. And while some may see them as the crazy ones, we see genius. Because the people who are crazy enough to think they can change the world, are the ones who do." -- Apple Computer Inc.

item.title: ConsciousNYC add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on." -- Robert Frost

item.title: ConsciousNYC add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: ConsciousNYC add a quote by Bill Cosby
item.description: "Women don't want to hear what you think. Women want to hear what they think - in a deeper voice." -- Bill Cosby

item.title: ConsciousNYC add a quote by Bob Marley
item.description: "The truth is, everyone is going to hurt you. You just got to find the ones worth suffering for." -- Bob Marley

item.title: ConsciousNYC add a quote by Bob Marley
item.description: "There will never be no love at all." -- Bob Marley

item.title: ConsciousNYC add a quote by Bob Marley
item.description: "Who are you to judge the life I live? I know I'm not perfect -and I don't live to be- but before you start pointing fingers... make sure you hands are clean!" -- Bob Marley

item.title: ConsciousNYC add a quote by Alice Sebold
item.description: "You save yourself or you remain unsaved." -- Alice Sebold
